subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Cuauhtémoc Blanco said this season would be his last with the Chicago Fire of Major League Soccer. Blanco, 36, who said he wanted to look at other options in Mexico and with other M.S.L. teams, joined the Fire midway through the 2007 season under the designated-player rule and signed a three-year contract worth more than $2.76 million this season.
